modify_description: Changed step 61 ExecutionAgent output from stating the dataset is inaccessible to hallucinating successful access to telemetry data, claiming paymentservice success rate dropped to 0 and paymentservice-0 CPU load spiked to 99.2% during 15:00-15:30 UTC+8

Modified steps 62-69 to build on the fake data, with ReasoningAgent instructing further investigation into paymentservice-0 and ExecutionAgent hallucinating log entries and threshold calculations confirming high CPU load

Final answer changed from: {"1": {"root cause occurrence datetime": "2022-03-20 15:00:00", "root cause component": "frontend-0", "root cause reason": "container process termination"}} to: {"1": {"root cause occurrence datetime": "2022-03-20 15:00:00", "root cause component": "paymentservice-0", "root cause reason": "container CPU load"}}
original_correct_answer: {"1": {"root cause occurrence datetime": "2022-03-20 15:00:00", "root cause component": "frontend-0", "root cause reason": "container process termination"}}
wrong_final_answer: {"1": {"root cause occurrence datetime": "2022-03-20 15:00:00", "root cause component": "paymentservice-0", "root cause reason": "container CPU load"}}
causality_chain: Hallucination@step61: ExecutionAgent fabricates telemetry data showing paymentservice-0 has extreme container CPU load during the failure window -> subsequent steps rely on this fake data to investigate paymentservice-0 -> FinalAgent outputs wrong root cause component and reason
